result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy L. Lassiter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court, inwriting, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION AS OF REVIEW HEARING ON 3/14/18.  Huber allowed.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Zach Brost appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent Christina Munger present.  Brief discussion held regarding unpaid financial obligations.  Court previously extended deft's probation for one year.  Court informed deft he needs to get these financial obligations paid off in 6mos.  Otherwise, the deft will need to be returned to court; Court will then impose an alternative to non-payment.
The deft's probation is extended for 1 yr, from current discharge date or until all court obligations are completed.
& Stipulation to Waive Appearance & Hrg

18CM104 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year commencing today.  Same conditions as those imposed in 15CM1652.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously provided.  Appeal rights.  

15CM1652 - deft sentenced to 150 days KCJ as a condition of probation commencing today.  Huber allowed.

Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Court finds the present charge is not a proper charge; charge amended to 943.15.  The word "dwelling" changed to "bldg."  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing set for 4/21/16 @ 11am.  Deft facing revocation sentencing in branch 6.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
